document.docAuthor: Murao, Ryuki, Lee, Heung-Sik & Tadauchi, Osamu
document.masterDocTitle: Bees of the Lasioglossum series (Hymenoptera: Halictidae) in South Korea, with an illustrated keys to species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bees of the Lasioglossum series (Hymenoptera: Halictidae) in South Korea, with an illustrated keys to species

[ Holotype : Natural History Museum, London, United Kingdom , ♀, type locality = Hakodate, Japan ];

[in key];

Pérez 1905
: 36
[ Type series: Muséum National d’ Histoire Naturelle, Paris, France , ♀, type locality = Yokohama, Japan ]. Synonymy by
Sakagami & Tadauchi ( 1995 : 187 , with Ebmer’s personal communication)
. Lectotype [Muséum National d’ Histoire Naturelle, Paris, France ] designated by
Ebmer ( 1996 : 272 )
.

Halictus moltrechti
Cockerell 1925
: 2
, 4 [in key] [ Holotype : U.S. National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution, Washington, DC, USA , ♀, type locality = Okeanskaja, Siberia (now Primorsk Terr., near Vladivostok), Russia ]. Synonymy by
Ebmer ( 1996 : 272 )
.

Halictus kraloffi
Cockerell 1925
: 3
, 4 [in key] [ Holotype : U.S. National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution, Washington, DC, USA , ♀, type locality = Kongaus, Siberia (now Primorsk Terr.: Anisimovka), Russia ]. Synonymy by
Ebmer ( 1996 : 272 )
.

Halictus emelianoffi
Cockerell 1925
: 7
[ Holotype : U.S. National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution, Washington, DC, USA , ♂, type locality = Okeanskaja, Siberia (now Primorsk Terr., near Vladivostok), Russia ]. Synonymy by
Ebmer ( 1996 : 272 )
.

Lasioglossum ( Lophalictus ) acuticrista
Pesenko 1986
: 126
[in key], 144 [ Holotype : Zoological Institute, Russian Academy of Sciences, St. Petersburg, Russia , ♀, type locality = Promorsk Terr., Russia ]. Synonymy by
Sakagami & Tadauchi ( 1995 : 187 , with Ebmer’s personal communication)
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Lasioglossum ( Lophalictus ) proximatum :
Pesenko 2006
, 137 [♂, illustration], 138 [in key], 139 [♂, illustration], 143 [in key], 160–162 .

Diagnosis. This species is similar to
L. sutshanicum Pesenko
from eastern Asia. The female is separated from that of
L. sutshanicum
(male not examined in the present study) by the posterior surface of propodeum, which has a complete lateral carina extending to a transverse carina (
Fig. 3
C). In contrast, in the female of
L. sutshanicum
the lateral carina of the propodeum is incomplete and it does not extends to a transverse carina (
Fig. 3
D).

Specimens examined. (n = 134 ) [ South Korea ] GW : Bougmyong-ri, Dongsan-myon, Chunchon-gun, 6 ♀,

FIGURE 2 .
A, C: mesoscutum. B, D: T 1 . E, F: propodeum. A, B:
Lasioglossum subopacum (Smith)
. C, D:
L. nipponicola Sakagami & Tadauchi. E
:
L. exiliceps (Vachal)
. F:
L. denticolle (Morawitz)
. A–F: ♀.

Distribution. North Korea , South Korea , Japan , China , Russian Far East. Murao et al . ( 2014 ) listed this species only from North Korea , but
Ebmer ( 1996 )
also recorded it from South Korea .

Flight period in South Korea .
Female: April to October. Male: July to August. In Japan , male flies from August to September (Murao 2014 ).

Flower records in South Korea .
This species has been recorded from at least 14 plant species in 12 families, as follows: Asteraceae :
Taraxacum
sp. Brassicaceae :
Brassica
spp. Caryophyllaceae :
Sagina japonica (Sw.) Ohwi.
Ericaceae :
Rhododendron
spp. Fabaceae :
Amorpha
sp. Geraniaceae :
Geranium thunbergii Siebold ex Lindl. & Paxton.
Lardizabalaceae :
Akebia quinata (Houtt.) Decne.
Oleaceae :
Forsythia suspensa (Thunb.) Vahl.
Rhamnaceae :
Rhamnus davurica Pall.
Rosaceae :
Malus toringo (Siebold) Siebold ex Vriese
;
Pourthiaea villosa (Thub.) Decne.
var. villosa
. Salicaceae :
Salix
sp. Styracaceae :
Styrax japonica Siebold & Zucc.
;
S. obassia Siebold & Zucc.
